entry.title: Re: Talent Intelligence Hub - Workflow for Proficiency Level Changes of an Attribute in Growth Portf
entry.content:
Hi @ujjalgupta2,

Our requirement is to not trigger the workflow when Manager updates the proficiency level in growth portfolio for their direct reports where we are planning to give permissions for both manager and their direct reports to change the proficiency level. So the workflow should trigger only when employee change the proficiency but it seems there is no option in the business rule logic to check subject user and logged-in user. How do we restrict this?

Thanks,

Thrilleswar.

entry.title: Re: Maximize Value with Value Analytics for SAP Ariba
entry.content:
Hi @SimonKranig , 

With regards to the data integration part for this Business content Datasphere model, is there also a possible approach to be done via the SAP Integration Suite and is there any guidance already available or could you please provide such one if possible? 

We are currently in process of implementing the SAP Ariba Spend Analysis Business content package and as per its Mission's guidance there is used the SAP Integration Suite, so we are wondering if the approach could be aligned potentially so that also for Value Analytics for SAP Ariba Procurement (SAP Datasphere) we use the SAP Integration Suite. 

Thank you very much in advance!

Best regards, Diana

entry.title: Re: Bulk UserID change in LMS
entry.content: @BegumGul, merging users in bulk (Merging Users in Bulk Through Import) appears to be a suitable approach. It’s recommended to engage an appropriate implementation/service resource (KBA 2149831) to assess potential implications and desired outcomes, thereby minimizing unforeseen results. Simultaneously, conducting an exercise in preview can help observe and test the entities involved.

entry.title: Sustainability Control Tower: Update on SAP-provided Metrics on ESRS regulation (continued)
entry.content:
This is a continuation of Sustainability Control Tower: Update on SAP-provid... - SAP Community

Co-author @elsandoval 

Disclaimer: This blog post reflects the state of the SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) as of July 25th,  2025. 

SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) supports customers on ESG reporting. Therefore, SCT enhances the coverage of metrics provided which are in line with the European Sustainability Reporting Standards (ESRS). 

This blog-post provides an overview of metrics which are planned or newly released and gets updated regularly. Please note that the names of planned metrics may be subject to change. For the full list of available metrics in SCT, please visit Metrics | SAP Help Portal 

Released Metrics (as of July 25th 2025)
In some cases metrics are marked as "(documentation only)". That means those datapoints are not part of the scope of standard metrics delivered by SAP and therefore documentation is provided in the help portal. This is the case if e.g. for quantitative metrics a customer specific breakdown is requested or for qualitative metrics, in case datapoints are already covered in other datapoints. 

Qualitative

Sustainability MatterMetric NameDisclosure RequirementData Point
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINAre All Value Chain Workers in Scope of Material IROs S2.SBM-3(11)(AR 6-AR 7)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINTypes of Value Chain Workers Subject to Material ImpactsS2.SBM-3(11a)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAIN(Documentation only)
Type of value chain workers subject to material impacts by own operations or through value chain
S2.SBM-3(11ai-v)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINGeographic Area/Commodity with Risk of Child/Forced Labor in Value Chain WorkersS2.SBM-3(11b)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINNature of Material Negative Impacts on Value Chain WorkersS2.SBM-3(11c)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINPositive Impacts on Workers: Activities, Affected Employee Type, and GeographiesS2.SBM-3(11d)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINMaterial Risks and Opportunities Related to Value Chain WorkersS2.SBM-3(11e)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINAssessment of Value Chain Workers at Greater Risk of HarmS2.SBM-3(12)(AR 8 )
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINMaterial Risks and Opportunities Related to Specific Value Chain Worker GroupsS2.SBM-3(13)(AR 9)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINHuman Rights Policy Commitments Relevant to Value Chain WorkersS2-1(17)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINGeneral Approach to Human and Labor Rights for Value Chain WorkersS2-1(17a)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINGeneral Approach to Engagement with Value Chain WorkersS2-1(17b)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINGeneral Approach to Enabling Remedy for Human Rights Impacts of Value Chain WorkersS2-1(17c)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINWorker Policies on Human Trafficking, Forced and Child Labor, and Supplier Code of ConductS2-1(18) (1)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAIN(Documentation only)
Undertaking has supplier code of conduct		S2-1(18) (2)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAIN(Documentation only)
Provisions in supplier codes of conduct are fully in line with applicable ILO standards		S2-1(AR 15)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINValue Chain Worker Policy Alignment to International InstrumentsS2-1(19)(AR 14)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINNon-Compliance with International Instruments Involving Value Chain WorkersS2-1(19)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINSignificant Changes to Value Chain Worker Policies in Reporting YearS2-1(AR 12)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINCommunication Types of Value Chain Worker Policies to Key Individuals, Groups, or EntitiesS2-1(AR 16)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINRole of Value Chain Worker Perspectives in Decisions on Worker Impact ManagementS2-2(22)(AR 20)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINDoes Engagement Occur Directly with Value Chain Workers or Workers' RepresentativesS2-2(22a)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINValue Chain Worker Engagement: Stages, Engagement Type, and FrequencyS2-2(22b)(AR 18 )
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINTop Position Senior Role with Operational Responsibility for Value Chain Worker EngagementS2-2(22c)(AR 17-AR 18 )
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINFramework Agreements with Global Union Federations on Human Rights of Value Chain WorkersS2-2(22d)(AR 19)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINAssessment of How Effectively Value Chain Workers are EngagedS2-2(22 e)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINSteps to Understand Views of Vulnerable/Marginalized People on Value Chain Worker ImpactsS2-2(23)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINLack of Value Chain Worker Engagement Process and Timeline for ImplementationS2-2(24) (1)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAIN(Documentation only)
Disclosure of timeframe for adoption of general process to engage with  value chain workers  in case the undertaking has not adopted a general process for engagement		S2-2(24) (2)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINApproach and Process to Remedy Negative Impacts on Value Chain WorkersS2-3(27a)(AR 21)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINChannels for Value Chain Worker ConcernsS2-3(27b)(AR 22)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINProcesses Supporting Availability of Feedback Channels for Value Chain Worker ConcernsS2-3(27c )
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINEffectiveness of Feedback Channels and Tracking Process of Value Chain Worker ConcernsS2-3(27d)(AR 27)

Planned Metrics (as of July 25th 2025)
In some cases metrics are marked as "(documentation only)". That means those datapoints are not part of the scope of standard metrics delivered by SAP and therefore documentation is provided in the help portal. This is the case if e.g. for quantitative metrics a customer specific breakdown is requested or for qualitative metrics, in case datapoints are already covered in other datapoints. 

Qualitative

Sustainability MatterMetric NameDisclosure RequirementData Point
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINValue Chain Worker Awareness and Trust Assessment in Concern Reporting ProcedureS2-3(28)(AR 26)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINPolicies Against Retaliation when Using Feedback Channels for Value Chain Worker ConcernsS2-3(28)(AR 25)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINStatement on Missing Feedback Channels for Worker Concerns and Timeline for AdoptionS2-3(29) (1)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAIN(Documentation only) Disclosure of timeframe for channel for raising concerns to be in placeS2-3(29) (2)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINChannel Access for Value Chain Workers in Relation to Material ImpactsS2-3(AR 23)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAIN(Documentation only) Third-party mechanisms are accessible to all workersS2-3(AR 24)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAIN(Documentation only) Grievances are treated confidentially and with respect to rights of privacy and data protectionS2-3(AR 25) (1)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAIN(Documentation only) Channels to raise concerns or needs allow for value chain workers to use them anonymously S2-3(AR 25) (2)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINActions to Prevent or Mitigate Negative Impacts on Value Chain WorkersS2-4(32a)(AR 38 )
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINActions to Provide Remedy to Impacts on Value Chain WorkersS2-4(32b)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINActions for Positive Impacts on Value Chain WorkersS2-4(32c)(AR 39)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINTracking and Assessment of Effectiveness of Actions on Value Chain WorkersS2-4(32d)(AR 33-AR 35)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINProcess to Identify Actions for Negative Impacts on Value Chain WorkersS2-4(33a)(AR 29)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAIN(Documentation only)  Description of approach to taking action in relation to specific material negative impacts on value chain workers  S2-4(33b)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINProcess Effectiveness to Provide Remedy to Impacts on Value Chain WorkersS2-4(33c)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINMitigation Actions of Value Chain Worker Risks and Tracking of EffectivenessS2-4(34a)(AR 40-AR 41, AR 43)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINIdentification of Severe Human Rights Incidents in the Value ChainS2-4(36)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINImpact Management of Value Chain Worker: Resource Allocation, Internal Functions, Action TypesS2-4(38 )
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINLeverage Use in Business Relationships to Manage Impacts on Value Chain WorkersS2-4(AR 30)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINResults from Actions for Positive Impacts on Value Chain WorkersS2-4(AR 36b)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAIN(Documentation only) Description of internal functions that are involved in managing impacts and types of action taken by internal functions to address negative and advance positive impacts S2-4(AR 44)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINTarget Setting Process for Managing Value Chain Worker-Related IROs S2-5(42a)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINTracking Performance of Value Chain Worker Targets S2-5(42b)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINImprovements from Tracking Performance of Value Chain Worker Targets S2-5(42c)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINIntended Results in Value Chain Worker Lives from Value Chain Worker TargetsS2-5(AR 45a)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINStability of Value Chain Worker Targets Over TimeS2-5(AR 45b)
WORKERS IN THE VALUE CHAINFoundation of Value Chain Worker TargetsS2-5(AR 45c)
AFFECTED COMMUNITIESType of communities subject to material impacts by own operations or through value chainS3.SBM-3(9ai-iv)(AR 7)
AFFECTED COMMUNITIESDisclosure of timeframe for adoption of general process to engage with affected communities in case the undertaking has not adopted a general process for engagementS3-3(24)

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud - FAQs
entry.content:
@SreekanthSurampally 

Customers can also create their  own data products using data from any SAP or non-SAP application. These are called customer-managed data products and are created and managed in SAP Datasphere.

The data and its related ORD file are stored in the customer’s storage area within SAP Datasphere (Embedded Object Store). Both customer-managed and standard data products work the same way — they are stored in an object store, described by an ORD file, and published in the SAP BDC Catalog.

If I'm correct, what's the purpose of restricting execution at Joule skill level if backend user authorizations are checked anyway ? In other words, is it not enough to ensure security at back-end level only ?

entry.title: Re: How to stop the Zero amt settlement document in the c...

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud - FAQs
entry.content:
@Buni - Please refer to the article: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/announcement-sap-datasphere-and-sap-analytics-cloud-availability-via-sap/ba-p/14140920 

1. Existing contracts are respected by SAP; however, renewal or new service using BTPEA/CPEA will not be available from Jan 1st, 2026, onwards.

2. Until the existing contract is due for renewal, or as a proactive action customer can use the rewiring tool (no technical migration) to move existing Datasphere, SAC tenants under the BDC model.\

Hope this helps - Jeet

entry.title: Re: Local RAP business event consumption in S/4HANA 2023 OP
entry.content:
If the events are not in a released API, then you can make a request to SAP via Customer Influence platform for new feature and hope that they put this on their roadmap.

Following page explains that business event can be consumed locally: Business Event Consumption | SAP Help Portal
I pasted the steps from there.

Creating an Event Handler Class

1. Create a class that will serve as the event handler class. For the introductory syntax of the global class, use the keyword FOR EVENTS OF, followed by the name of the behavior definition that contains the event to be consumed.

 
CLASS cl_local_event_consumption DEFINITION
						PUBLIC
						ABSTRACT
						FINAL
						FOR EVENTS OF root_entity.
 

2. In the definition section of the local class contained in the Local Types, include cl_abap_behavior_event_handler as superclass to inherit from.

 
CLASS lcl_local_event_consumption DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_event_handler.
 

3. Define a method for each event to be handled. In the method signature, specify the importing parameter, the entity, as well as the event to be consumed.

 
PRIVATE SECTION.
              METHODS consume_event_1 FOR ENTITY EVENT importing_parameter_1 FOR my_entity~event_1.
              METHODS consume_event_2 FOR ENTITY EVENT importing_parameter_2 FOR my_entity~event_2.
            ...ENDCLASS.

            CLASS lcl_local_event_consumption IMPLEMENTATION.
            METHOD consume_event_1.
              CHECK importing_parameter_1 IS NOT INITIAL.
            ... ENDMETHOD.

            METHOD consume_event_2.
              CHECK importing_parameter_2 IS NOT INITIAL.
            ... ENDMETHOD.
            ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Enhancing Your SAP Support Experience – Sunset of Ask an Expert Peer
entry.content:
Your support experience matter! – and we are evolving with purpose to meet your changing needs and provide you with the best support experience. As technology advances and business demands grow, we continuously refine our support strategy to deliver faster, smarter, and more personalized assistance. As of July 1, 2025, we simplified our support channels by retiring the Real-Time Support live channel “Ask an Expert Peer” in SAP for Me. This change is the beginning of a more agile and connected support experience.

What Changed?

To better align with your needs, we’ve officially retired the Ask an Expert Peer option in SAP for Me. You may notice that the familiar button has been removed from the ‘Best Action’ recommender in the ‘Get Support’ application.

Why the Change?

By sharpening our focus on proven support live channels, we’re enhancing your ability to get answers when you need them. SAP is committed to delivering a consistent, intelligent, and outcome-driven support experience. After careful evaluation and customer feedback, we are consolidating our efforts into scalable and intelligent Real-Time Support channels that offer broader coverage and tighter integration into SAP's support and product ecosystem.

  • Faster Resolutions: By focusing on the most effective channels, you’ll get answers and solutions quicker than ever.
  • Consistent Expertise: Enhanced live channels provides you access to the best expertise.

We encourage you to take full advantage of SAP’s Real-Time Support portfolio, designed to give you faster answers, expert guidance, and AI-powered insights when and where you need them.

What Does It Mean for You?

  • In SAP for Me, you’ll now be seamlessly guided to our highest-performing live support channels like Case, Expert Chat, Schedule a Manager and Schedule an Expert.
  • If you previously relied on Ask an Expert Peer, transitioning to these optimized channels will feel intuitive and efficient.

💡Good to know: Want to keep content from your previous Ask an Expert Peer sessions? You can export your history via the ‘Case List’ application.

Note:
Ask an Expert Peer will continue to be available in the Ariba Help Center. You can find more information in this SAP Knowledge Base article: 2998816 - Ask an Expert Peer - Frequently Asked Questions - SAP Technical Support

Your SAP Support Team

entry.title: How can we implement automatic QM inspection lot with stock relevant in repetitive production
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We are facing a case where we need to setup QM inspection lot on repetitive process , the plant only use planned orders and never convert them in Production orders or process orders

I can not use inspection 04 because not planned for repetitive production

i can't neither use inspection type 03, 13 because they are not stock relevant , the 09 type seams not working as well...

The client need to have a QM inspection lot automatically generated each time he fixed his planned order, when movements 261 and 131 iare done, the confirmed Quantities appears on "inspection lot Stock" under statut "Q" and then they can make a usage decision 

Do you know how can we implement this ?

 

Tnank you for your help and support

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud - FAQs
entry.content: @SreekanthSurampally - It's not mandatory to create a Data Product in SAP Datasphere (existing flow of local tables, ETL, views, analytical model can be created); however, in the SAP BDC, it's all about Data products, zero-copy share. So if you wish to share data with Databricks using SAP BDC, then you need Data Products

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere catalog - Harvesting from SAP BW/4HANA
entry.content:
Hi @PuneetMishra Based on the information provided, I would start by verifying the SAP Cloud Connector setup

  1. Confirm that the Cloud to On-Premise system mapping has been completed and is correctly configured in the SAP Cloud Connector.
  2. Ensure that the BW/4HANA resources are properly defined in the SAP Cloud Connector.
  3. Verify that the system is up to date and that the relevant services are enabled, as described in SAP Note 3601550.

Next, test the BW/4HANA endpoints in your preferred browser to ensure they are accessible.
For example:

  • https://<bw4hana-host>/sap/bw/ina/GetServerInfo
  • https://<bw4hana-host>/sap/bc/http/sap/bw4/v1/system/information

Regards,
Babu

entry.title: Re: Setting up SAP Launchpad Service and SAP Mobile Start with Content Federation
entry.content:
I’ve integrated my SAP On-Premise system with SAP BTP using Content Federation, and created a site using SAP Build Work Zone (Standard Edition).

Everything seems to be working in terms of tile visibility — I can see all the Fiori standard apps from my On-Premise system in the Work Zone site.

However, I'm facing two issues:

Issue 1: Fiori Apps Prompt for Login (Work Zone)

  • SAP GUI-based apps (like classic transactions) open immediately when clicked on them.

  • But for Fiori UI5 transactional apps, when I open them for the first time, they show the SAP Fiori Launchpad logon screen (coming from the On-Premise system) on my build workzone. After entering credentials once, the app runs as expected.

  • Not sure why is this happening 

Issue 2: SAP Mobile Start – Tile Click Leads to “Server IP Could Not Be Found”

  • When I access the same Work Zone site via the SAP Mobile Start app, the tiles appear correctly.

  • However, when I tap a tile:

    • The app attempts to launch in a browser view.

    • But it fails with a white screen and an error:
      “<mylaunchpadhost> server IP address could not be found.”

entry.title: SAC Waterfall Custom Hierarchy Dimension
entry.content:
Dear all,

In the waterfall chart, I want a total to appear as an intermediate subtotal. See below a desired representation:

 

I have created a custom group hierarchy in SAC (YearMonth) based on the Calendar Month dimesnion (see screenshot).

 

In the chart, I select the hierarchy YearMonth  for the dimension Calender Month.

However, the selected hierarchy does not seem to appear in the widget. The output looks the same as if I had chosen the flat representation.

I suspect that the hierarchy is not active or not applied properly.

Where can I activate or enable the hierarchy so it becomes visible in the chart?

Thanks & KR,

Viktoryia

entry.title: Experience with Workhuman + SAP SuccessFactors EC Integration?
entry.content:
I’m exploring the integration between Workhuman and SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central and would love to hear from anyone who has implemented or evaluated this.  

  • How seamless is the integration?  
  • What use cases have you enabled (e.g., syncing recognition data, reporting)?
  • Any technical or functional challenges when it comes to integration?
  • Has it improved employee engagement or HR operations?

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central integration to SAP Business Suite 

Your insights would be incredibly helpful. Feel free to reply here or message me directly. Thanks in advance!

— Rochelle Griffith

entry.title: Re: Consume an Event using Event Consumption Model
entry.content:
Hello @SafaBahoosh ,
Standard event doesn't have the information that is needed by the event consumer, so our requirement is to trigger a custom event whenever a standard event is triggered. I tried event extension(using Derived Events concept explained in the blog below), but event extension is possible only with S4 2023(ABAP 7.58 or later) and we are still on S4 2022(ABAP 7.57).
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/derived-events-how-to-trigger-custom-event-from-an-sap-standard-event/ba-p/13955193

I then tried to consume events locally using a local event handler(similar to example mentioned in below blog). However, CLASS FOR EVENTS keyword used to consume events locally is again available only with S4 2023.
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/working-with-rap-bo-events-end-to-end-event-driven-architecture-event/ba-p/14018775

Another option is to create an event consumption model, to consume an event from Event mesh. But this doesn't look like an efficient way, since we are trying to consume an event from event mesh that was  originally triggered locally.

What are the options to send a custom payload (whenever a standard event is trigged) on S4 OP 2022 (other than the legacy ways)?

entry.title: Re: Working with RAP BO Events end-to-end - Event-driven-architecture - Event framework
entry.content:
Hello @mlauber  ,
Standard event doesn't have the information that is needed by the event consumer, so our requirement is to trigger a custom event whenever a standard event is triggered. I tried event extension(using Derived Events concept explained in the blog below), but event extension is possible only with S4 2023(ABAP 7.58 or later) and we are still on S4 2022(ABAP 7.57).
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/derived-events-how-to-trigger-custom-event...

I then tried to consume events locally using a local event handler(similar to example mentioned in this blog). However, CLASS FOR EVENTS keyword used to consume events locally is again available only with S4 2023.

Another option is to create an event consumption model, to consume an event from Event mesh. But this doesn't look like an efficient way, since we are trying to consume an event from event mesh that was  originally triggered locally.

What are the options to send a custom payload (whenever a standard event is trigged) on S4 OP 2022 (other than the legacy ways)?

It's not really possible to tell more without additional information and exact details about the perceived performance problem.

entry.title: Issue with Adopt UI – "Publish" Button Disabled for Custom Field in Sales Order Workflow
entry.content:
Dear Expert

I am facing an issue in the Flexible Workflow for Sales Orders in our SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud system.

I have added a custom field "User Remarks" using Custom Fields and Logic, which is used in the workflow for managerial approval. The field is successfully visible when I try to add it using Adopt UI, but the "Active New Version" and Publish Version" buttons remain greyed out, so I am unable to activate or use this field in the workflow screen.

Steps taken:

  1. Created a custom field "User Remarks" in the Sales Document context.
  2. Enabled it for the relevant UI and workflow scenarios.
  3. Tried to add it in the UI via Adaptation Mode (Adopt UI).
  4. The field appears, but Publish is disabled, blocking further progress.
  5. This is impacting our internal sales approval process, where remarks are required before the manager approves the order.

Could you please assist or advise if there’s a missing configuration or limitation?

The issue has been highlighted in green colour

entry.title: Links para a transmissão ao vivo dos eventos #SITSP2025 e #SITSP2025DEV
entry.content:
O SAP Inside Track São Paulo 2025 é um marco na comunidade SAP brasileira!

O evento em São Paulo possui 2 Tracks de conteúdo simultâneos:  FUNCTIONAL e DEVELOPERS, repletos de palestras sobre as inovações mais recentes, como SAP S/4HANA, BTP, Clean Core, IA generativa e integração com o mundo fiscal e financeiro.

Com centenas de participantes, especialistas renomados e apresentações memoráveis, a comunidade se fortaleceu ainda mais. Veja abaixo a agenda completa das sessões com os respectivos links para os vídeos no YouTube.

Live #SITSP2025FUNC

entry.title: Succession Org Chart Reporting
entry.content:
Hello! We are using position-based SOC (succession org chart) WITHOUT position management. We are trying to see if there is a way to capture periodic reporting snapshots of the SOC if vacant positions drop off due to the intricacies that happen with our org chart sync process.

Has anyone found the ability to take snapshots of the SOC through Report Center? The fields there seem limited, Specifically, we want to capture through a report vacant positions and their successors before they inadvertently drop off the SOC due to timing issues and other things unique to the sync process.

A periodic reporting snapshot would help this, but there doesn't seem to be the full field set to do so. Any ideas? Again, the root problem we are trying to solve for is when vacant position tiles drop off, and we need to restore them manually. Need a report to tell us what specific information to restore for that tile that dropped off.

We are also in the midst of troubleshooting our succession org chart sync process. Is there a call anytime with this group to exchange experiences and learn best practices that other customers have had troubleshooting their SOC data and keeping it clean?

entry.title: Queue Browser: Deep Message Visibility for Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Introduction

In event-driven architectures, messages flow continuously between systems, carrying critical business data and triggering essential processes. When something goes wrong—messages pile up, integrations fail, or data appears corrupted—you need immediate visibility into what’s happening inside your queues. Without this insight, troubleshooting becomes a frustrating game of guesswork.

Monitoring message queues is essential in event‑driven architectures. It reveals queue health and uncovers bottlenecks, providing crucial delivery and routing insights that ensure system reliability. With the latest release of Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite, we’re excited to announce Queue Browser, a new capability that delivers deep message visibility through an intuitive web‑based interface.

The key advantage: Visualizing and inspecting messages using Queue Browser won't consume them from the message broker queue, so you can safely examine message metadata—such as headers, statuses, and errors—and troubleshoot malformed payloads without disrupting live processing.

What is Queue Browser in Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite?

Queue Browser is a web-based monitoring and diagnostics tool that allows you to inspect messages in a queue without consuming them from the message broker queue. Think of it as a "read-only window" into your message queues—you can see everything that's happening without affecting the actual message flow.

Queue Browser bridges the gap between high-level queue metrics and detailed application logs, giving you the message-level insight needed for effective troubleshooting.

Key Capabilities

  • Search & Filter: Quickly locate messages by criteria such as message ID, correlation ID, and custom properties.
  • Header, Payload, and Custom Properties Inspection: View standard JMS-style headers (timestamp, delivery mode, Dead Message Queue eligibility) and examine the message payload alongside any custom properties. This is invaluable for validating data transformations and ensuring message integrity.
  • Message Management: Identify and inspect stuck or problematic messages in queues, with the option to delete them when needed.
  • Purge Queues: Clear all messages from a selected queue in one action, ideal for resetting test environments or clearing backed-up queues during maintenance.

Queue Browser in action

Accessing the Queue Browser

Step 1: Navigate to Queue Monitoring

In the SAP Integration Suite Cockpit, open the left‑hand menu and navigate to:

Monitor › Event Mesh › Queues

Step 2: Review Queue Metrics

You’ll see a comprehensive table listing all your queues with real-time usage metrics:

Monitoring Event Mesh Usage – Queue List Floorplan

  • Name: The name of the queue
  • Messages Queued: Number of messages in the queue
  • Unacknowledged Messages: Number of unacknowledged messages in the queue. Messages delivered but not yet acknowledged as processed.
  • Queue Size: The queue size in bytes.
  • Max Queue Size: The maximum size possible for the queue in bytes.

These metrics provide immediate insight into queue health—high unacknowledged message counts often indicate processing issues, while queues approaching their size limits may need attention.

Step 3: Drill Down to Message List

Message List Report Floorplan

Select any queue to drill down to its message list page, where you can view some per‑message information:

  • Message ID: Identifier for tracking messages
  • Correlation ID: Identifier to trace the request journey
  • Time Sent: Time the message was sent
  • Message Size: The size of the message content, in bytes
  • Redelivered: Indicates if the message was redelivered or not—a key troubleshooting indicator
  • Destination: Destination of the message
  • DMQ Eligible: Indicates whether the message is eligible for the Dead Message Queue (DMQ)

Step 4: Inspect Individual Messages

Message Details – Object Page Floorplan

Click a message entry to navigate to its details page. The level of access depends on your assigned roles:

Users can review the message headers by default; if your BTP user has the EventMeshBusinessExpert role collection assigned, you’ll also see the full payload and any custom properties.

Security Note: Access to single‑message inspection is restricted to specific roles only. Only users assigned the EventMeshBusinessExpert role collection should be granted permission to view full message payloads and custom properties and delete messages. This ensures that message access is tightly controlled per organizational requirements and can be managed via Configuring User Access.

Message Detail Components

Headers Information

  • Identifiers
    • Message ID: Identifier for tracking messages
    • Correlation ID: Identifier to trace the request journey
  • Delivery Information
    • Time Sent: Time the message was sent
    • Redelivered: Indicates if the message was redelivered or not—a key troubleshooting indicator
    • Delivery Mode: The mode which is used for message delivery
  • Routing Information
    • Destination: The destination of the message
    • Reply To: The address or topic to which the recipient should send the response, when a message that requires a reply or acknowledgment, is published.
    • DMQ Eligible: Indicates whether the message is eligible for the Dead Message Queue (DMQ)
  • Additional Information: Message size in bytes

Payload

The message payload contains the actual business data being transmitted between systems.

Custom Properties

Custom properties contain business-specific metadata that applications attach to messages. These might include:

  • Customer IDs for filtering
  • Source system identifiers for tracing

This metadata is invaluable for understanding message context and implementing sophisticated filtering strategies.

Available Actions

From the message detail page, users with appropriate permissions can:

  • Delete individual problematic messages
  • Download message payloads for offline analysis
  • Copy message IDs and correlation IDs for use in other tools

Conclusion

The Queue Browser for Event Mesh in SAP Integration Suite transforms how you monitor and troubleshoot event-driven systems. By providing safe, non-disruptive message inspection, it empowers you to validate message content before processing, diagnose complex integration issues, and ensure smooth data flow.

Next Steps

  1. Explore Queue Browser in your SAP Integration Suite tenant—navigate to Monitor › Event Mesh › Queues
  2. Review the official documentation:
    • Monitor Event Mesh
    • Configuring User Access
    • Personas & Permissions
  3. Share your experience on the SAP Community—help others understand how Queue Browser improves their troubleshooting workflows

Queue Browser puts the visibility and control you need right at your fingertips. Start exploring your message queues today and experience the difference that comprehensive message visualization and inspection makes in maintaining event-driven architectures.

Happy monitoring!

entry.title: Why the Future of SAP Consulting Delivery Is More Human
entry.content:
For years, SAP Consulting delivery has been seen as a technical and structured exercise: timelines, modules, go-lives, KPIs. But that view is no longer enough. The projects that fail today do not fail because of technical errors, they fail due to a lack of connection, empathy, and emotional leadership.
Success in consulting delivery is no longer just about what is delivered, but how people experience it, those who execute it and those who receive it.
In the context of S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition implementations, where speed, standardization, fit-to-standard and early adoption are essential, the human component becomes even more critical. The agility that this model demands cannot be achieved by technology alone, it requires teams and leaders who can manage uncertainty, enable rapid change, and support users through their adaptation journey to cloud technology.
Cloud-based projects require clear communication, empathetic leadership, and strong emotional management to ensure that transformation is not only implemented but successfully adopted and embraced. In this environment, emotional intelligence and executive coaching are not “nice to haves”—they are core skills to maximize delivery value.
In my role as a Senior SAP ERP Cloud Consultant, specialized in Finance (Management Accounting, Asset Accounting, Budget Control, and Financial Projects), I have led complex projects across Latin America.
I am also an Executive Coach in Emotional Intelligence and Neuro Linguistic Programming and I’ve seen first-hand that when we apply human tools to delivery:
•  Teams perform better, with less burnout.
•  Clients feel understood, not managed.
•  Trust becomes a competitive advantage.

The SAP Consulting delivery of the future will be:
•  Technical + Human
•  Structurally rigorous + Emotionally intelligent
•  Process-based + People-powered

If we want more agile organizations, more strategic consultants, and more engaged clients, we need leaders who listen, support, connect, and communicate with humanity.
Because the system we implement matters.
But the system we are as people, is what truly transforms.
And you? Are you leading in a more human way?

entry.title: Add HTML tracking script to a requisition
entry.content:
Where can we add HTML code of a tracking script to help us monitor a recruitment campaign?

This would only apply to ONE requisition so CSB didn't seem appropriate, however the job requisition Header or Footer rich text editor box does not have an HMTL option (like the box does on this forum!)

It's not a cookie, just a <script> block with 10-12 lines of HTML that will track foot traffic and "Apply" clicks.

entry.title: Re: User activity (FI, MM, SD, CO, etc.)
entry.content:
Hello @javierm_9230 ,

Here is synopsis of information in a nutshell. This might help you.

 

AreaTransaction/TablePurpose / DescriptionKey Fields / Notes
Transaction UsageSTADShows transactions executed by usersT-code, user, start time, duration
 ST03N → Expert ModeWorkload by user / T-code usageDrill down by date/user/transaction
FI – FinanceTable: BKPFDocument headers, user posting dataUSNAM = User, CPUDT = Entry date
 Tables: CDHDR, CDPOSTracks changes to financial documentsOBJECTCLAS = FIDOCUMNT (or similar), USERNAME, UDATE
MM – Materials MgmtTable: MKPFMaterial document headersUSNAM, CPUDT
 Tables: CDHDR, CDPOSChanges to materials and MM master dataOBJECTCLAS = MATERIAL
SD – SalesTable: VBAKSales document headers (who created what)ERNAM = Creator, AUDAT = Document date
 Tables: CDHDR, CDPOSChange logs for sales documentsOBJECTCLAS = VERKBELEG
Change DocumentsCDHDR, CDPOSGeneral change logs across modulesUSERNAME, UDATE, OBJECTCLAS, OBJECTID
Security Audit LogTransaction: SM20Logins, T-code usage, RFCs (if audit log active)Requires prior configuration
 Transaction: SM19Security audit log configurationEnable logging per user/event
User InformationTransaction: SUIMView user changes, authorizations, roles, executed transactionsUse "Change Documents for Users", etc.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Can someone explain how AccountTrnx FR2 versus Accrua...
entry.content:
Hello @goody-1 ,

Check below points, hopefully it should work:-

1. Go to ME23N, go to Conditions tab, Ensure Planned Delivery Cost box is checked for freight condition. Only Planned Delivery Costs post during GR — others are posted during invoice.
2. Go to transaction: M/06 (Condition Types), field: "Acct Key" = FR2, Checkbox: "Planned Delivery Cost" = Yes
3. Check in OBYC for FR2 - if GL account is assigned

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: On the Manage Purchase Order app, logic to determine the Create Purchase Order - Advance app?
entry.content:
On the Manage Purchase Order app, how does the system determine the Create Purchase Order - Advanced app?

What's the logic to open a particular PO in "Fiori app" vs. "Create Purchase Order - Advanced app"?

What do I need to change to ensure that all my POs are open in "Fiori App"

 

SAP Helps says that "if a purchase order has a feature that is not supported...." But the question is, which features are not supported?

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/af9ef57f504840d2b81be8667206d485/28f492016a52485784d85b7a31f7542d.html

If a purchase order has a feature that is not supported by the Fiori app, this is indicated by the icon "i" (='Advanced' Purchase Order) in the list. In this case, you can jump directly from the list in the Manage Purchase Orders app to the relevant purchase order that is then opened automatically in the classic Create Purchase Order - Advanced app.

entry.title: Re: Test environment does not display information on KE24
entry.content:
Hello @Daniela_M ,

Verify if below things help..

-Verify operating concern is active - t-code - KEKE / KEBC
-Activate environment for PA10- t-code - KEBC
-Regenerate structures for CE1/CE3 - t-code - KE4S
-Check summarization levels (optional) - t-code - KEU1
-Run KE24 again

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Custom Situation Handling Object via ADT
entry.content:
Hello @Giacomo_Savioli 

You're right, custom Situation Handling objects are not yet available in SAP S/4HANA Public cloud via ADT. Currently, you can only work with predefined situation types using the Manage Situation Types app.

SAP has not announced a release date for this capability in the S4 Public cloud. For updates, it's best to follow the SAP Roadmap Explorer or submit feedback via the Customer Influence Portal.

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Re: RV Documents not picked in F110
entry.content:
Hi @Mohamed_Shoaib ,

1. Check OBA7 for RV document type. Ensure both "D" (Customers) and "K" (Vendors) account types are allowed for RV. This is critical for netting with RV documents.
2. Verify Payment Method on RV documents: Display an RV document in FB03 and confirm a valid payment method is populated.
3. Review FBZP settings for Payment Method:
-Confirm the payment method allows both incoming and outgoing.
-Ensure "Customer/Vendor check" is active for the payment method in the company code settings.
4. F110 Additional Log Analysis: Run the proposal with the detailed log and analyze the output to pinpoint the exact reason for the RV documents being skipped. This log is your best friend in debugging F110 issues.
5. Due Dates and Payment Blocks: Confirm the RV documents are due and not blocked.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Auto‑release of next QM task triggered by a task completion + block manual release
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts,

I need to implement an SAP Business Workflow scenario in QM that does the following:

  1. The workflow is triggered when a QM task (BOR QMSM object) is completed.

  2. The workflow checks if there's a next task within the same quality notification.

  3. If a second task exists, the workflow should automatically release that second task.

  4. Users must not be able to manually release the second task before the first task is completed and the workflow triggers.

Could anyone guide me on:

  • How to identify and retrieve the next task of the notification in the workflow?

  • How to call the RELEASE method automatically via workflow?

  • How to prevent manual release—either via application logic or configuration—until the business logic (first task completion) is satisfied?

Thanks in advance for any direction or examples!

entry.title: While Saving WO using Fiori app - Change Maintenance Order - Selecting Events not getting Saved
entry.content:
Hi ,

When saving a Work Order (WO) using the Fiori app - Change Maintenance Order, selecting Events does not update the Start and End dates of the WO, and the Events are also not being saved. This issue has been observed since the system was upgraded to FPS03 and SAP Note 3555105  Version 3 Implemented.

 
Note : Events are being saved using the new app 'Manage Maintenance Orders', and dates are also being updated. However, this functionality is not working through Change Maintenance Order.

Please suggest. thanks.

Riyaj
